pros: Really supported whilst I was working there
Brilliant support and people around you. The environment here is one of motivation and progression.
cons: I think the software can be learnt in less than the 4 weeks assigned for training.

review_title: Horrendous employers from start to finish!!! AVOID!
pros: The team you work with are more than likely all in the same boat as you so you meet some good people working there.
cons: The staff turnover is so high because they just push people into the job and then stop showing any interest as soon as you're employed. Management are completely uninterested in their team and regularly miss one-to-ones and appraisals. You can never book time off because they are so short staffed due to high turn over and your holidays can't be rolled over so you basically never get to use your annual leave. Have no interest in making staff happy which is why turnover is so high. It's an emotional and high stress job with 0 support. Would never recommend to anyone.

pros: You colleagues (other health advisors and some clinical advisors) are the only good thing about this job.
cons:
You are definitely not paid enough for this job.
No proper management for night staff.
Do as I say and as I do attitude.
It's who you know not what you know.
If you want to have a life as well as a job this isn't the job for you.

review_title: The worst compant I have ever worked for
pros: Parking available. Relatively lots of shifts so flexible working time.
cons: This is by far the worst company I have ever worked for and I have been a doctor for in excess of 25 years. Firstly there is a bullying culture here. Doctors, nurses and other staff have left in droves. People have had mental health breakdowns due to this companies management. CQC even came in and criticised the management and one of the centres they run. They run a "favours for mates" culture". The management is absolutely clueless. They think they are good but are not looking at their feedback.

pros: Great place to work, with great prospects and benefits. The NHS pension is superb, and Westfield Health benefits are great. The company is widely regarded across the NHS as a premier provider, and the staff are a huge factor in this. New divisions are being created all the time as DHU expands into new counties, so there are prospects for advancement everywhere.
cons:
SSP only for the first 6 months, plus no Westfield Health either. 
Maternity/paternity is poor compared to wider NHS.

review_title: A progressive, flexible and supportive company
job_title: Emergency Care Practitioner in Leicester, England
pros:
- good pay and NHS pension!  
-  flexible working pattern
- responsive management 
- progression and development funded (including university modules) 
- portfolio career- so opportunity to move around the company in various settings
cons:
- a lot of out of hours work, but that’s the nature of the work. 

- Working in the healthcare setting comes with the usual stresses

review_title: Worst place you can ever work at
pros: There are no pros in working for this company.
cons:
Lack of support
Will mess around with your money
Payroll staff incompetent
Service Managers are incompetent
Staff are degraded
No chance at progression
Will keep you at health adviser level just to keep service levels up
Hostile Environment 
They collect money for Managers who are leaving but not the staff who keep the service going.
Horrible environment
CEO does not care.
Target Driven
Operational managers do nothing but go on smoke breaks and turn their phone down if they do not want to speak to you.

job_title: Human Resources Business Partner in Leicester, England
pros:
Great teams to work with 
Good job satisfaction 
Opportunities to train & develop are a plenty 
Fast paced & never boring
cons: Pay isn’t inline with role & responsibilities or inline with market rates

job_title: NHS 111 Call Handler in Derby, England
pros: Good hourly rate. Free tea and coffee. Out of hours free parking available. Caring call takers who will support you.
cons: Badly managed. Tough targets. Poor support after training. Understaffed and very pressurised environment. Poor leaders.

pros:
Has limited car parking for staff, plus you can park near by.
Near to shops at pride park.
Easy to get to from a52
cons:
Limited amount of clinical staff to support call handlers.
Chasing your own tail for help.
Expect to feel demoralised by end of your shift.

pros: Helping others in times of need
cons: It can be stressful at times

pros: There are no pro's to working for Derbyshire Health United. Being on benefits is a better option
cons: Loss of social life, moral compass, rights
